items.def: Mentions Jesus condemned by Pilate with followers persisting written ~93 CE relevant because a non Christian Jewish historian confirms Jesus and Pilate
Mentions James the brother of Jesus who is called Christ written ~93 CE relevant because it anchors Jesus family and early Jerusalem leadership
Describes John the Baptist and execution by Herod Antipas written ~93 CE relevant because it corroborates Gospel reports about John and Herod
Reports Christus executed under Pontius Pilate during Tiberius written ~116 CE relevant because a hostile Roman source confirms crucifixion timing and official
Notes Jewish disturbances at Rome instigated by Chrestus written ~120 CE relevant because it aligns with Acts 18 on the Claudian expulsion
Describes Christians who sing to Christ as to a god and bind themselves to moral oaths written ~112 CE relevant because it shows early worship of Jesus and regular assemblies
References Yeshu executed on the eve of Passover compiled 3rd-5th century CE relevant because it is a hostile witness to the execution timing
Mocks Christians who follow a crucified sage 2nd century CE relevant because it shows outsiders recognized a crucified founder and a distinct community
Cites Paul and echoes Jesus around 96 CE relevant because it proves early circulation and authority of apostolic teaching within one generation
Affirms death and resurrection under Pilate around 110 CE relevant because it fixes core beliefs early and independently of the later Gospels
